shortdesc.ph: Sets the external audio source parameters.
Sets the external audio capture parameters.

p.codeblock: abstract setExternalAudioSource( enabled: boolean, sampleRate: number, channels: number, localPlayback?: boolean, publish?: boolean ): number;
abstract setExternalAudioSource( enabled: boolean, sampleRate: number, channels: number, localPlayback?: boolean, publish?: boolean ): number;
Future<void> setExternalAudioSource( {required bool enabled, required int sampleRate, required int channels, bool localPlayback = false, bool publish = true});
public abstract int SetExternalAudioSource(bool enabled, int sampleRate, int channels, bool localPlayback = false, bool publish = true);

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel.
You need to call this method before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable the use of external audio sources:
: Enable external audio source.
: (Default) Disable external audio source.
Sampling rate (Hz) of the external audio source. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.
Number of channels of the external audio source. Can be set to 1 (mono) or 2 (stereo).

Whether to play the external audio source locally:
: Play locally.
: (Default) Do not play locally.

Whether to publish the audio to the remote end:
: (Default) Publish to remote.
: Do not publish to remote.

Whether to enable the use of external audio sources:
: Enable external audio source.
: (Default) Disable external audio source.
Sampling rate (Hz) of the external audio source. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.
Number of channels of the external audio source. Can be set to 1 (mono) or 2 (stereo).

Whether to play the external audio source locally:
: Play locally.
: (Default) Do not play locally.

Whether to publish the audio to the remote end:
: (Default) Publish to remote.
: Do not publish to remote.

Whether to enable the external audio source:
: Enable the external audio source.
: (Default) Disable the external audio source.
The sample rate (Hz) of the external audio source. You can set it to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.
The number of channels of the external audio source. You can set it to 1 (mono) or 2 (stereo).

Whether to play the external audio source locally:
: Play locally.
: (Default) Do not play locally.

Whether to publish the audio to the remote:
: (Default) Publish to the remote.
: Do not publish to the remote.

Whether to enable the use of an external audio source:
: Enable external audio source.
: (Default) Disable external audio source.
The sample rate (Hz) of the external audio source. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.
The number of channels of the external audio source. Can be set to 1 (mono) or 2 (stereo).

Whether to play the external audio source locally:
: Play locally.
: (Default) Do not play locally.

Whether to publish the audio to the remote end:
: (Default) Publish to the remote end.
: Do not publish to the remote end.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
